Narrator

Before long, Titus and I vacated our vehicle, went inside, and began ascending the spiraling staircase.

Narrator

We eventually reached the top. I was nearly out of breath, whereas Titus seemed to breeze through it without breaking a sweat.

Narrator

We were met by two guards standing alongside a wooden door, one of whom opened it for us. I stepped inside while Titus remained behind.

Narrator

The room, a sanctuary of ancient knowledge was dimly lit. The air carried the scent of aged books and burning incense. Candles cast a soft glow around the room.

Player_Romus

"Sal, my trusted advisor, I have been looking forward to this visit."

Player_Romus

"Most people know to stand when their king enters the room."

Player_Romus

"I hope I'm not interrupting anything."

Sal Ignacius

"Forgive my oversight, Your Majesty. I didn't realize you had entered. I've been immersed in arrangements for tonight's momentous occasion."

Narrator

He looked up as if startled.

Sal Ignacius

"The cosmos has a language of its own. Tonight, it speaks of destiny and the intertwining of fates."

Sal Ignacius

"Certainly. I'd be delighted to provide you with an overview of the prevailing sentiments within our religious communities."

Sal Ignacius

"It holds a unique place in their hearts and is as diverse as the stars above. As for their overall prevailing sentiments..."

Sal Ignacius

"It occupies a distinctive corner in their hearts, as diverse as the stars that grace the night sky. As for their overall prevailing sentiments..."

Sal Ignacius

"I hope to do more than just translate, but decipher the cosmic narrative, as embodied by your loyal subject below."

Narrator

Sal's eyes lit up, illuminated by faint moonlight.

Sal Ignacius

"Fellow Wruhecists overwhelmingly favor your reign."

Sal Ignacius

"The restoration of the Archsanctuary of Plavo has helped solidify their support."

Sal Ignacius

"As were the state's welfare programs."

Player_Romus

"Our people thrive when their faith is strong. And the Dastnurists?"

Player_Romus

"Good. The last thing we need is a Wruhecist revolt on our hands. What about the Dastnurists in our realm?"

Sal Ignacius

"Overall, they appreciate the preservation of their well-being as a minority religion."

Sal Ignacius

"They see it not only as a physical expansion but also as a symbolic representation of the growth and preservation of their religious heritage within our kingdom."

Sal Ignacius

"It goes without saying that the blasphemy law continues to strain relations."

Sal Ignacius

"It would have surely added to their list of grievances had it been implemented."

Player_Romus

"It's a challenge to navigate the religious landscape, Sal. I want unity, but not at the cost of freedom."

Player_Romus

"Fingers crossed that we've hit the stability sweet spot and it doesn't nosedive."

Player_Romus

"Oh, good. I'd hate to think they'd consider putting me on their exclusive 'List of Grievances.'"

Player_Romus

"Navigating the diverse religious terrain, Sal, is quite a challenge. My goal is to foster unity without compromising individual freedom."

Player_Romus

"The idea of Rizians and Palesians taking arms against each other gnaws at my soul. I wonder, does Wruhecism permit such conflict? Is it justified?"

Sal Ignacius

"War contradicts these principles, causing suffering and discord."

Player_Romus

"Does Wruhecism condemn taking back what's rightfully ours by force? Or is it merely a convenient shroud for the weak?"

Player_Romus

"In the midst of this war, I find myself yearning for a swift end to the conflict. Can Wruhecism provide insights or principles that align with my hope for a peaceful resolution?"

Player_Romus

"And how do we know if going to war with Pales aligns with the text in which you speak?"

Player_Romus

"Justified? That wasn't what I was expecting to hear. Please continue."

Player_Romus

"And how do we know if going to war with Pales aligns with the divine order?"

Player_Romus

"I respect the pursuit of peace, but I'm curious about how strength and ambition can coexist within our faith."

Player_Romus

"A complicated philosophical dilemma, indeed."

Player_Romus

"I seek to defend our kingdom, Sal. To ensure that the divine pillars flourish and that Wruhecism prevails."

Player_Romus

"Couldn't it be both?"

Sal Ignacius

"War should be the last resort, employed only when all avenues for peace have been exhausted."

Player_Romus

Yet, positioning war as the ultimate recourse might lead to overlooked opportunities or even outright defeat."

Player_Romus

"Our intentions must be pure, then. We must ensure that our war serves not personal gain but the divine order."

Player_Romus

"While I value the guidance of the divine, my responsibility lies with the well-being of my people. If war is the route to strength, I'll seek to align our faith with the path that ensures the prosperity of our realm."

Player_Romus

"I believe this war is justified. If we don't act, we risk not only our principles but the safety and well-being of our people."

Player_Romus

"Then, I suppose I'll need to guarantee that my next move in this conflict aligns with the principles of Wruhecism to ensure its justification, as provided by our sacred text."

Player_Romus

"I believe this war is justified. If we don't act, we risk not only our principles but the safety and well-being of our people. In defending ourselves, we preserve the very values we hold dear."

Player_Romus

"With all due respect, religious dogma is a guiding tool, not a master."

Sal Ignacius

"May the divine guide our actions, Your Majesty, and may our pursuit be just, in accordance with the sacred teachings."

Sal Ignacius

"There's nothing weak about adhering to one's religious values."

Sal Ignacius

"War contradicts these principles, causing suffering and discord. Wruhecism stresses the importance of peace and the quest for harmony."

Sal Ignacius

"Wruhecism doesn't shackle ambition; it guides it toward righteousness."

Player_Romus

"What if the divine order aligns with expansion, conquest?"

Sal Ignacius

"It firmly opposes any form of subjugation."

Sal Ignacius

"While wealth and territory are earthly pursuits, the divine order transcends material gains."

Sal Ignacius

"War is not the path to true power. It's a path to destruction, and a kingdom built on such foundations will crumble."

Sal Ignacius

"I fail to find any humor when it comes to war."

Player_Romus

"Come now, Sal, surely there's a divine loophole for a good, hearty war."

Player_Romus

"War might be serious business, but imagine if we could solve conflicts with sarcastic banter."

Sal Ignacius

"There are indeed instances in the sacred texts where war is justified, but it's not a divine loophole for merriment."

Player_Romus

"To be perfectly honest, I fear that keeping Rizia under one religious banner might lead to further divisions and unrest within our borders."

Player_Romus

"Wruhecisim, Dastnurism, Golcondism... it’s all the same to me. It's maintaining order and preserving the monarchy that's most important."

Player_Romus

"Wruhecisim, Dastnurism, Golcondism – it's like trying to distinguish between different shades of beige. I'm more concerned about maintaining order and ensuring the monarchy stays uncharacteristically bland."

Sal Ignacius

"Well, it goes without saying that I'm partial to Rizia as a Wruhiescist state, but I will concede that there is more than one approach that could be considered."

Player_Romus

"I want you to speak as a man of faith."

Player_Romus

"Oh, don't play coy. Just tell me what you think."

Player_Romus

"I want your unbiased opinion, obviously."

Player_Romus

"Those being?'

Sal Ignacius

"That said, as your counselor on religious affairs, I'm more than happy to share my unbiased thoughts."

Sal Ignacius

"Alternatively, we could embrace a pluralist faith-based state, recognizing the diverse spiritual threads that weave through our realm."

Sal Ignacius

"Lastly -- I can't believe I'm saying this -- you could separate religion from government entirely, taking a secular approach that would allow each citizen the freedom to navigate their faith independently."

Player_Romus

"What are the pros and cons of remaining a Wruhecistic state?"

Sal Ignacius

"All of which, bear in mind, come with specific drawbacks and advantages."

Player_Romus

"Tell me what a governance that accommodates Nurity as a whole would look like."

Sal Ignacius

"Personal feelings aside, the key element of taking a pluralistic approach lies in establishing a framework that respects diversity while maintaining a common ground for governance."

Sal Ignacius

"Unlike a singular religious influence, which might inadvertently exclude a portion of our population. And risk fostering resentment and alienation among those who don't adhere to the chosen faith."

Sal Ignacius

"While I appreciate the sentiment, I find it challenging to fully embrace a pluralistic approach. Wruhecism, as the guiding force, has provided a stable foundation for our kingdom."

Player_Romus

"Are we not risking stifling diversity and limiting the freedom of our citizens to choose their own faith?"

Player_Romus

"I don't know... keeping religion out of government altogether might be a more sensible approach. The last thing we'd want is for Rizia to turn into another theocratic state like Derdia."

Player_Romus

"But doesn't it risk losing the moral compass that religion often provides in governance?"

Sal Ignacius

"Yes, I believe it would. However, to entertain a counterpoint, there are those who'd argue that it allows for a moral framework that is not exclusive to a particular faith."

Sal Ignacius

"Deviating from this course not only risks uprooting our heritage but dishonors the sacrifices of your forefathers who fought to uphold Wruhecism's teachings."

Player_Romus

"I value the history and legacy of our kingdom, but I also believe in progress, and the need to ensure the rights of all our citizens. A secular government may be the answer we need."

Sal Ignacius

"That it would create a societal framework where citizens, irrespective of their religious affiliations, can coexist under a common set of ethical standards. But again, I would be wary of such an approach. "

Player_Romus

"While I acknowledge the importance of progress, I firmly believe in upholding the traditions that have guided us for generations. A secular government might not be the solution we need."

Sal Ignacius

"Considering the historical success of upholding moral principles rooted in religious foundations, one must question whether a secular framework can generate an equivalent level of personal and collective commitment to maintaining high moral standards."

Sal Ignacius

"Additionally, it risks diluting the cultural and moral fabric woven by Wruhecism, making us strong. Deviating from this course not only uproots our heritage but dishonors the sacrifices of forefathers who fought for Wruhecism's teachings."

Player_Romus

"Good, my thoughts exactly."

Sal Ignacius

"Of course. Forgive me. This subject holds significant importance for me."

Player_Romus

"Risks are inherent in any course of action, but with careful consideration, we can navigate through them. However, Iet's hear your concerns."

Sal Ignacius

"One of my foremost concerns is the proposition of equal treatment for all religions in governance. This could jeopardize the sacred and distinct guidance we receive from Wruhecism in our decision-making processes."

Player_Romus

"I cannot argue with the deeply held beliefs of such a large part of the Rizian populace. I see merit in the idea of establishing Rizia as a holy kingdom governed by Wruhecist law."

Player_Romus

"As I see it, the best way forward to fostering unity may involve embracing not just Wruhecism, but Dastnurity as well."

Player_Romus

"I'm inclined to believe that the path ahead calls for a secular approach, underlining a governmental non-intrusive stance in religious affairs, freeing us from taking sides."

Player_Romus

"Embracing a secular path would mark a revolutionary inception to liberate our kingdom from the oppressive chains of religious influence, allowing the radiant dawn of true communal enlightenment to break free."

Narrator

A moment of silence fell between us. Even the night seemed unable to cloak his obvious disapproval.

Player_Romus

"You've given me a lot to think about. It seems whatever direction I take regarding our religious future holds the power to mold the very essence of our kingdom."

Sal Ignacius

"A noble pursuit, Your Majesty. However, I would encourage you not to take a course of action that undermines the core principles of Wruhecism."

Sal Ignacius

"With all due respect, calling it a 'significant backlash' would be putting it mildly. More like a tempest of dissent and upheaval that could shake the very foundations of our kingdom."

Sal Ignacius

"I too share your concerns. However, I would encourage you not to take a course of action that undermines the core principles of the one true faith."

Narrator

I continued overlooking the city, as the echoes of Sal's council reverberated in my mind.

Narrator

I knew any path I chose regarding Rizia's religious future carried the risk of creating a backlash -- if I chose to change anything at all, that is.

Sal Ignacius

"My God... it's even more breathtaking than I could have ever imagined."

Sal Ignacius

"With all due respect, Your Majesty, declaring neutrality *is* taking a side. A secular approach may lead to a cultural vacuum, devoid of the spiritual principles that have held us together."

Sal Ignacius

"Your Majesty, I regret to say that I cannot endorse this point of view. It would risk severing the ties that bind us culturally and spiritually. And you are coming dangerously close to using the language of Malenyevism."

Sal Ignacius

"However, as your councilor, I stand by your decision either way."

Player_Romus

"A divine spectacle, indeed."

Player_Romus

"Nice view, but let's not overthink it, Sal."

Player_Romus

"Well, at least the stars got their act together. Unlike some courtiers I know who never seem to align their opinions."

Player_Romus

"Inspirational, perhaps, for those with stargazing hearts."

Sal Ignacius

"Your Majesty, your power is a guiding light that can illuminate the path to righteousness."

Narrator

Sal leaned in with a fervent glint in his eyes.

Sal Ignacius

"By issuing decrees and government mandates aligned with the principles of Wruhecism, you could ensure that its teachings permeate every corner of our kingdom."

Player_Romus

"I'm still not 100% certain this is the plan I wish to pursue. But I won't close off the possibility."

Player_Romus

"I would never replace my uncle, Grand Wiseman. Besides, I know him to be a man of faith as well."

Sal Ignacius

"Replacing your uncle would have to be done with the utmost sensitivity, of course."

Narrator

After descending the observation tower and stepping outside with Titus, I was once again greeted by the celestial phenomenon above.

Titus Gordion

"Absolutely, Your Majesty. My apologies. The extraordinary view momentarily captured my attention."

Titus Gordion

"Lost, but in the best possible way. It's as if the heavens themselves are telling a story."

Narrator

After savoring the spectacle for a final moment, Titus guided me to my motorcade, and I resumed my journey back to the palace.

Narrator

Titus quickly assumed a professional manner and escorted me back to the motorcade, where I resumed my journey back to the palace.

Narrator

Titus promptly adopted a professional demeanor, accompanying me back to the motorcade, from where I continued my journey back to the palace.

Narrator

Turning his attention away from the heavens, Titus guided me to my motorcade, and I resumed my journey back to the palace.

Narrator

Taking a final moment to appreciate the spectacle, Titus directed me to the motorcade, and I proceeded on my way back to the palace.

Narrator

After absorbing the spectacle for a final moment, Titus directed me to my motorcade, and I continued my journey back to the palace.

Sal Ignacius

"Introducing multiple faiths risks diluting the principles that have anchored us for generations."

Sal Ignacius

"May our actions be guided by the divine, Your Majesty, and in accordance with the sacred teachings."

Narrator

However, it now functioned more as a museum than for astronomical observations due to the city's light pollution. It served as a tangible relic of Rizia's bygone era when celestial wonders were more easily unveiled.

Player_Romus_Italic

I had been looking forward to this extraordinary occasion for quite some time -- eager to see what the stars would reveal.

Player_Romus_Italic

I preferred a quiet night in my study over this celestial spectacle. But duty required that I attend.

Narrator

I was irritated that I had to make such an ascent, especially since there wasn't a working elevator to take us to the top, but I couldn't let my displeasure show.

Narrator

Appearing weak or disgruntled was not an option.

Narrator

Startled, he raised his head to meet my gaze.

Narrator

His gaze lifted abruptly, a hint of surprise in his eyes.

Player_Romus

"No harm, no foul."

Player_Romus

"Think nothing of it."

Player_Romus

"Well, I did."

Player_Romus

"I could reenter if you'd like to try again. Shall I?"

Player_Romus

"That I am. It symbolizes the timeless connection between our faith and the heavens."

Player_Romus

"Of course, I am. I'm offended that you would even consider the possibility of my ignorance on the topic."

Player_Romus

"That I am. The celestial alignment holds great importance in our religious heritage."

Player_Romus

"Indeed, I've been rehearsing my 'impressed by the universe' face for weeks now."

Player_Romus

"Yes, I've been preparing myself for weeks to genuinely appreciate the awe-inspiring spectacle of the celestial alignment."

Sal Ignacius

"Indeed it does."

Sal Ignacius

"Splendid!"

Sal Ignacius

"Excellent!"

Sal Ignacius

"Very well then. Let's move on to our main event."

Sal Ignacius

"If you'll follow me, we can continue our discussion on the balcony, where we may witness the magnificence of the event unfold before us."

Sal Ignacius

"Forgive me. That was never my intention."

Narrator

Sal respectfully bowed his head.

Narrator

Sal offered a respectful bow of his head.

Sal Ignacius

"I'm glad you think so."

Player_Romus

"Vaguely... I mean, I know about it as much as the next person."

Sal Ignacius

"That pleases me to hear it."

Sal Ignacius

"I'm surprised to hear it. In that case..."

Narrator

The wise man's face lit up with a gracious smile.

Narrator

Disappointment was evident in the expression on his face.

Narrator

The wiseman's face brightened.

Narrator

Sal cleared his throat and began to pace around the room.

Player_Romus

"Damn. Looks like we won't bear witness to the alignment after all."

Sal Ignacius

"Cloudy skies may conceal the celestial wonders, but with patience, the beauty may yet be revealed."

Sal Ignacius

"Perhaps the alignment is just waiting for the right moment."

Sal Ignacius

"Let's be patient. Their intentions may unfold in due time."

Narrator

As requested, I stepped into the cool evening air alongside him. I took in the sight of Porte Drazon sprawled beneath, its lights flickering like stars in the night.

Sal Ignacius

"In the tenets of Wruhecism, there unfolds a celestial saga—the Alignment of the Six Stars."

Sal Ignacius

"St. Wruhec perceived the alignment as a symbol of spiritual evolution -- a journey toward a more harmonious interconnectedness of the cosmic and spiritual realms."

Player_Romus

"I must say, you're quite the orator. Your recounting was truly stirring."

Player_Romus

"You had me at 'In the tenets of Wruhecism.' Well done!"

Player_Romus

"Sorry, I got distracted. Could you repeat that once more?"

Player_Romus

"Thank you, Sal. Your oratory skills would make St. Wruhec proud."

Sal Ignacius

"If that's what you desire, then so be it."

Narrator

A look of frustration crossed the Grand Wiseman's face.

Sal Ignacius

"And that's what we're here to bear witness to tonight."

Sal Ignacius

"I appreciate the feedback."

Player_Romus

"Ah! That's right. Now I remember. Thanks for the reminder."

Sal Ignacius

"My pleasure, Your Majesty."

Player_Romus

"Come on, no need for the long face. I'm only kidding. Well done."

Player_Romus

"In light of our impending conflict with Pales, I'd like to understand the religious context and implications of our actions."

Sal Ignacius

"I'd be more than happy to illuminate the spiritual facets entwined with our current situation. What would you like to know?"

Player_Romus

"Does Wruhecism unequivocally denounce reclaiming what is rightfully ours through force? I mean no disrespect, but could it be that invoking pacifism is a convenient justification for those who lack strength?"

Sal Ignacius

"I'd argue that pacifism shows incredible strength."

Narrator

He motioned toward the city below, where celebrations of tonight's event could be heard.

Sal Ignacius

"It began when funding for the restoration of the Archsanctuary of Plavo was denied."

Sal Ignacius

"The Crown's anti-welfare position is also fueling rising discontent, perceived as indifference toward those outside the aristocracy."

Player_Romus

"Sal, I appreciate your concern, but my approach aligns with divine providence, focusing on the greater good for the entire realm."

Player_Romus

"Sal, the Crown's stance against welfare is a deliberate choice, aimed at fostering self-sufficiency and long-term stability for every citizen in the realm."

Sal Ignacius

"Not if that discontent spirals into upheaval beyond our control. As for Dastnurists..."

Sal Ignacius

"While I respect the Crown's decision, shunning welfare may plant the seeds of unrest among those who see it as a disregard for their struggles."

Sal Ignacius

"Unfortunately, that's not how it's being perceived. As for the Dastnurist community..."

Sal Ignacius

"I have no doubt that your decisions are rooted in the realm's well-being. As for the Dastnurists…"

Player_Romus

"In these challenging times, we must prioritize where our funds are allocated. The Crown's resources are finite, and tough decisions must be made to ensure the stability of the entire realm."

Sal Ignacius

"As a community predominantly composed of Wehzek and Rumburgians, their perception is that your lack of acceptance for diversity has diminished respect among them."

Sal Ignacius

"Withholding financial support for the Dastnurist Grand Sanctuary of Sallabes has notably diminished Your Majesty’s likability within their community."

Sal Ignacius

"Which pretty much covers my present assessment of the religious conditions in Rizia."

Sal Ignacius

"The lifting of the blasphemy law has strengthened relations."

Sal Ignacius

"Moreover, they strongly condemn your banning of Derdian Golcondists from entering Rizia, adding to their list of grievances."

Player_Romus

"Let their list of grievances grow; I remain undeterred.”

Player_Romus

"Their condemnation is recognized, and I am committed to addressing their concerns."

Player_Romus

“I hear their condemnation and pray for understanding."

Player_Romus

"I acknowledge their concerns and remain steadfast in addressing issues, even as their list of grievances grows."

Player_Romus

"I made it to their exclusive ‘Grievance List?' I should start autographing copies for posterity.”

Player_Romus

"Their community's well-being is under the careful stewardship of the Crown. I've chosen a path of benevolence, allowing their stability to flourish."

Player_Romus

"Stability is a currency I control. They are fortunate I haven't bankrupted their community."

Sal Ignacius

"I understand the importance of safeguarding our realm, Your Majesty. However, we must tread carefully to ensure our actions align with the principles we hold dear."

Sal Ignacius

"Yes. Because nothing says 'world peace' like a sarcastic comment followed by an eye roll."

Player_Romus

"He says while rolling his eyes..."

Player_Romus

"Don't get cute with me. Sarcasm is reserved for your king."

Sal Ignacius

"The circumstances to which I'm referring are serious matters. They are no laughing matter. They must align with the divine order."

Sal Ignacius

"I appreciate your humility, but as sovereign of this realm, it isn't necessary."

Sal Ignacius

"I assure you, I wasn't being cute. But in any case..."

Sal Ignacius

"In the yearning for peace, Wruhecism indeed holds principles that advocate for harmony and unity. The emphasis on peace, however, comes with a nuanced understanding."

Sal Ignacius

"It's a delicate balance. The scriptures acknowledge just wars -- conflicts fought in defense of the divine message or to protect the pillars of enlightenment."

Sal Ignacius

"The balance between peace, strength, and ambition is a delicate interplay within the mosaic of Wruhecism, but it  need not be contrary to these ideals."

Player_Romus

"Yet we find it throughout our history."

Player_Romus

"Some might call it a necessary evil."

Sal Ignacius

"But keep in mind..."

Sal Ignacius

"Nevertheless, the divine order acknowledges growth and expansion."

Sal Ignacius

"'Growth and expansion?' Let's be honest. That's a nuanced way of saying conquest by force."

Player_Romus

"I never said that."

Player_Romus

"You see right through me."

Sal Ignacius

"I've been in politics a long time, Your Majesty."

Sal Ignacius

"But it doesn't make it right or just."

Player_Romus

"Agreed. They are pillars of guiding lights on our spiritual journey."

Sal Ignacius

"Precisely, Your Majesty. If we find ourselves compelled to engage in war, it must be undertaken with a somber resolve, burdened by the weight of righteousness."

Sal Ignacius

"Exhaustion from conflict is nothing compared to the exhaustion of rebuilding a shattered kingdom."

Sal Ignacius

"I understand the complexities you face in leading our kingdom."

Narrator

Sal looked at me, his eyes appearing to convey a shared understanding.

Sal Ignacius

"I strongly encourage you to take time to reflect on this and reconsider."

Player_Romus

"Good, as you should."

Player_Romus

"I can see that this proposal troubles you. But rest assured that your concerns will be carefully considered as we navigate this path together."

Player_Romus

"And you might very well be right. I've yet to fully come down on this one way or another, and will give your concerns serious consideration."

Narrator

Sal hesitated momentarily before bowing in respect.

Player_Romus

“A secular approach allows for the coexistence of diverse beliefs, promoting tolerance and understanding within our realm.”

Player_Romus

"I understand your concerns, but it seems to me that a non-theistic approach would ensure that we protect the beliefs of all our citizens, without imposing one faith over another.”

Player_Romus

“While I respect your viewpoint, it seems that a secular approach would better safeguard the freedom of religious expression, preventing any one belief from overshadowing the others in our kingdom.”

Sal Ignacius

"However, it's my conviction that this path may lead to a significant moral decline."

Sal Ignacius

"I harbor no intention of contradicting you, Your Majesty. My unwavering commitment is and always will be to the crown."

Sal Ignacius

"I'd argue that a more inclusive approach would foster an even richer environment for religious expression."

Player_Romus

“As I see it, taking such an approach is essential to ensure a government that respects all beliefs and promotes unity.”

Sal Ignacius

"With all due respect, I believe that would inadvertently sideline important cultural and spiritual values that contribute to our kingdom's unity."

Sal Ignacius

"If that's the way you feel about it, I see no reason to continue this debate."

Player_Romus

"This is the right path for Rizia. I can feel it with every fiber of my being."

Player_Romus

"And what qualifies you, Grand Wiseman? Do not forget that I am the one whom our Lord God chose to reign over this kingdom."

Sal Ignacius

"Yes, Your Majesty. So can I."

Sal Ignacius

"Certainly, Your Majesty. I am confident that if we do not alienate them, they will find their way to the one true religion sooner or later."

Sal Ignacius

"Does he truly believe, Your Majesty? Or is Wruhecism a mere garment for him, one that he puts on to appease his province?"

Sal Ignacius

"Yes, Your Majesty. I will. In the meantime, I will remain optimistic."

Sal Ignacius

"In any case, it's been a pleasure speaking to you on this grand occasion. I am honored we could witness it together."

Sal Ignacius

"It's been a pleasure speaking to you on this grand occasion. I am honored we could witness it together."

Player_Romus

"Climbing the ladder, are we, Sal? I didn't take you for the power-hungry type."

Sal Ignacius

"My loyalty lies in serving you and Rizia. I believe I can do both better by taking on a more proactive role in government."

Sal Ignacius

"I'm pleased to hear it."

Sal Ignacius

"Despite our differing views, it's been a pleasure speaking to you on this momentous occasion. I am honored that we could witness it together."

Sal Ignacius

"I don't wish to contradict you, Your Majesty. My duty has, and always will be, to the crown."

Sal Ignacius

"I believe that alternate paths would better preserve the spiritual integrity of our realm."

Player_Romus

"Don't get your hopes up. Grand Wiseman. My decision is unlikely to budge."

Player_Romus

"I must be honest. I don't foresee a change in my decision."

Player_Romus

"I hear your plea and I appreciate your dedication.  I'll certainly take your words into consideration."

Player_Romus

"Perhaps there's merit in your words. I'll give due consideration to other possibilities."

Sal Ignacius

"I'm pleased to hear it. As always, my loyalty lies in serving you and Rizia, regardless."

Sal Ignacius

"Be that as it may, I am still here to guide you."

Sal Ignacius

"Your Majesty, I have faith in your ability to arrive at the most judicious conclusion."

Sal Ignacius

"Thank you, Your Majesty. As always, I'm here to serve."

Sal Ignacius

"However, I foresee a considerable moral decline as a potential consequence."

Sal Ignacius

"I have no desire to contradict you, Your Majesty. My allegiance remains steadfastly with the crown, as it always has been."

Sal Ignacius

"I value your presence tonight, but I believe the best course is for me to appreciate the rest of this cosmic miracle in quiet solitude."

Sal Ignacius

"It was viewed as diverting resources away from crucial Wruhecist initiatives."

Sal Ignacius

"It was viewed as a slap in the face towards supporting much-needed Wruhecists initiatives."

Sal Ignacius

"It goes without saying that their commitment to Golcondism extends into every facet of their daily existence. It is an integral part of their cultural identity, shaping their traditions, values, and social interactions."

Sal Ignacius
